intro: Cryptantha clementina, commonly known as the Clemantine bluebell, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowering period occurs in late spring to early summer, adding vibrant color to its natural habitat. The plant is also valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological benefits to local pollinators.
